author: @lakeguy65616
text: risk free return is the 90 day T-bill rate, not the 10 year Treasury bond.

author: @lucascerro8189
text: So if the market "always goes up", why does quantopian prefer a "neutral" alpha? Shouldn't they favor an alpha factor that has an upward slope that matches the market? I'm just finding it strange that we are being forced to go short on good sentiments just to maintain that distribution

author: @aniketchatterjee77
text: Any sharpe ratio above 1.5 or more is unachievable in real world-public market trading
